-e ---
---
Even though the exact pronunciation fluctuated significantly over dialects and centuries, we have a quite stable core in many Egyptian and [Akkadian](Akkadian.html) words:  

In general the more syllables a recorded word has, the greater the confidence in a relative continuity of the pronunciation:  

word | meaning | preserved variants

Akkadian being a Semitic language, the correspondences are countless:
ğ’•ğ’ | da-buÊ³ | the [Bear](Bear.html) | ×“×‘× debÄ

Egyptian being an Afroasiatic language, the correspondences are many:

ğ“ˆ™ ğ“ ğ“…‚ ğ“†‰ | turtle | schildpad Ü£Ü Ü˜Ü¦ÜÜ¬Ü sallÅpÌ„Ä«á¹¯Ä ğ’Šºğ’ˆœğ’ #Å¡eleppÃ» ğ’ƒ»ğ’…®ğ’ˆ¾ â€¢Å¡Ã¡Ë¡buna â‰ˆ ğ’Šºğ’‚—ğ’…®ğ’ˆ¾ Å¡e-en-bunâ‚‚na [PSM](PSM.html)ğ“†„ ğ“…± ğ“ ğ“® ğ“‚¡ | trader | #Å¡wt à¦¸à¦“à¦¦à¦¾à¦—à¦° Å›Ã´wdagÃ´r à¤¸à¥Œà¤¦à¤¾à¤—à¤° áƒ¡áƒáƒ•áƒ“áƒáƒ’áƒáƒ áƒ˜ sovdagari  Ø³ÙˆØ¯Ø§Ú¯Ø± sowdÃ¢gar sÃ¶vdÉ™gÉ™r  


preserved proper nouns:  
ğ“ƒ€ ğ“…® ğ“„¿ ğ“‚‹ ğ“¤ ğ“¡ ğ“„¿ ğ“˜ ğ“‡‹  lake â€˜bairkati Arabic â€˜Birketâ€˜ !! Ø¨Ø±ÙƒØ© vs Ø§Ù„Ø¨Ø­ÙŠØ±Ø©

# Many Sumerian and Akkadian words found their way into Semitic branches almost unchanged:
ğ’„‘ğ’ƒ¶ğ’ˆ¾ bukÄnu ×‘×•×›× ×” bÅ«á¸µÄnÄ "pestle"

# Egyptian locations
Many Egyptian locations have their names derived from ancient names:  
Ø¯Ù…Ù†Ù‡ÙˆØ± Damanhour  ğ“‚§ ğ“‡ ğ“‡‹ ğ“‡‹ ğ“Š– ğ“Œ ğ“…„ domain horu "House/City/Settlement of Horus" â²¡Ï¯â²™â²“â²›Ì€Ï©â²±â²£ ×ª×× ×—×•×¨ TemenkhÅ«r
